evidence.source_document: Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree
evidence.text: JOINT MOTION FOR PROVISIONAL APPROVAL AND ENTRY OF CONSENT DECRE

extracted.value: United States of America filed a Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree on October 7, 2024, requesting the court to provisionally approve and enter the attached Consent Decree, schedule a Fairness Hearing, and stay all deadlines pending the court’s determination.

evidence.text: 10 | 2024-12-19 | Joint MOTION to Stay Case Management Deadlines by UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.

extracted.value: United States of America filed a Joint Motion to Stay Case Management Deadlines on December 19, 2024, asking the court to stay all case‑management deadlines pending the resolution of the Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree.

evidence.text: 13 | 2025-01-10 | Consent MOTION to Exceed Word Limitation by UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.

extracted.value: United States of America filed a Consent Motion to Exceed Word Limitation on January 10, 2025, requesting the court to allow the briefing to exceed the standard word limit for the case.

evidence.text: 14 | 2025-01-14 | MOTION for Leave to File Amicus Brief and Appear at Argument by American Alliance for Equal Rights.

extracted.value: American Alliance for Equal Rights filed a Motion for Leave to File an Amicus Brief and Appear at Argument on January 14, 2025, asking the court to grant leave to file a brief and to appear at the argument.

evidence.text: 21 | 2025-01-30 | Motion Submitted to JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER: 21 MOTION to Seal.

extracted.value: United States of America filed a Motion to Seal on January 30, 2025, seeking to seal the documents filed in the case.
